_header: Lief Lord my soul Thou spare
_description: The nine lessons of the Dirige or ‘Pety Iob’ — fifty-seven 12-line stanzas with refrain, Parce michi domine

BodDou322.First Lines:
Lyef lord my soule thow spareThe sothe I sey now
                    sykerly…
BodDou322.Last Lines:
…so that I maye euer with the dwelleThorough Parce mihi
                        domine
BodDou322.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the nyne lessons of the Dirige whych Job made in hys
                    tribulacioun lying on the Donghyll and ben declared more opynly to lewde mennes
                    vnderstanding by a solempne worthy and discrete clerke Rychard Hampole and ys
                    cleped pety Job and ys full profitable to stere synners to compunccioun (f.
                        10ra); Here endeth the ix lessons of the dirige which Job
                    made in his tribulacion (col)
